availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Fannin Kitchen in Carter County, Kentucky, on December 3, 1846. Father of John Kitchen, James Kitchen, Sarah Kitchen, Julia A. Kitchen, Martha Kitchen, Rachel Kitchen, and David Kitchen. Farmer in Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 234A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 575.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Precinct 11, p. 300A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film 001759301, p. 28.
